plugins.name: CTRLFRK:GRAD
plugins.description:
GRAD gives you unprecedented control over colour transitions through the power of Bezier curves. This sophisticated plugin brings laboratory-grade precision to your gradient work through highly-customisable curves. Manipulate how colours blend across HSB components, visualise transitions in real-time, and achieve interpolation paths that were previously impossible. Perfect for brand work, illustrations, and UI design where colour transitions matter.


  1. Create expressive colour gradients with precise Bezier curve control
  2. Independently manipulate hue, saturation, and brightness curves for nuanced transitions
  3. Apply preset curves (ease-in, ease-out, S-curves) for common gradient effects
  4. Visualise and fine-tune with an interactive interface
  5. Generate exact colour stops based on mathematical interpolation
  6. Apply gradients directly to selected objects or create new gradient rectangles
plugins.tagline: Precision gradient control for the colour obsessed

132857.name: CTRLFRK:GRAD
132857.description:

Manipulate how colours blend across HSB components, visualise transitions in real-time, and achieve interpolation paths that were previously impossible. Perfect for brand work, illustrations, and UI design where colour transitions matter.


  1. Create expressive colour gradients with precise Bezier curve control
  2. Independently manipulate hue, saturation, and brightness curves for nuanced transitions
  3. Apply preset curves (ease-in, ease-out, S-curves) for common gradient effects
  4. Visualise and fine-tune with an interactive interface

  6. Apply gradients directly to selected objects or create new gradient rectangles
132857.release_notes: This update delivers key under-the-hood improvements for a more stable and reliable GRAD experience.
132857.tagline: Precision gradient control for the colour obsessed

plugins.name: FileFlow
plugins.description:
FileFlow helps you instantly create organized file structures in Figma with predefined workflows for different project types.

Create consistent, well-structured Figma files without the tedious manual work. With FileFlow, you can:


Choose from pre-built templates for different workflows (Research, UI Design, Webflow, Product, Agency, and more)

  1. Create custom page hierarchies with intuitive organization
  2. Add sections and dividers to group related pages
  3. Use emoji icons to visually distinguish different page types
  4. Save time on project setup with one-click implementation


Perfect for teams that want to standardize their Figma file organization or individuals looking to streamline their workflow. FileFlow makes it easy to maintain clean, professional file structures that improve collaboration and productivity.


Tags

organization, workflow, file structure, pages, productivity, project management, templates, file setup

These details have been optimized for searchability while accurately describing what your plugin does. The description highlights key benefits and features that would appeal to Figma users looking for organization solutions. I've also included relevant tags that potential users might search for when looking for plugins like yours.
plugins.tagline: Organize your Figma files with custom page structures and workflows in one click

plugins.name: Diopter
plugins.description:
This plugin helps you see how you are using remote components for linked and unlinked libraries. For example, you can find mobile components in a file with only desktop explorations. With a tool like this, you can being spring cleaning now and get your files squeaky clean.


To use this plugin, you'll need to create a personal access token with read-only access to files. I needed that token to be able to get details about file librariesâe.g., library name. The first time you run the plugin, you'll be asked to paste the token.
plugins.tagline: Clearly see which components you're using and where they come from.

127509.name: Diopter
127509.description:
This plugin helps you see how you are using remote components for linked and unlinked libraries. For example, you can find mobile components in a file with only desktop explorations. With a tool like this, you can being spring cleaning now and get your files squeaky clean.


To use this plugin, you'll need to create a personal access token with read-only access to files. I needed that token to be able to get details about file librariesâe.g., library name. The first time you run the plugin, you'll be asked to paste the token.
127509.release_notes: Adds a way to find frames that used to be components.
127509.tagline: Clearly see which components you're using and where they come from.

plugins.name: Postcard Generator Experiment
plugins.description:
This plugin is a study project for the Generative AI course at the Innopolis University.


It tries it's best to generate greeting cards by combining layout generation, user-uploaded photos, a custom AI-generated poem and a thematic AI-generated background.


To run, get a token at an https://openrouter.ai and place it as the only text block on an empty page.


For help feel free to write me at levada.andrew@gmail.com


Github â https://github.com/andrewlevada/postcard-generator-experiment
plugins.tagline: A study project: a couple of llm's trying their best to design

Magix - AI Text Generator enables seamless text creation for your designs using OpenAIâs API.


After connecting the API, simply select the text elements (Text objects, Sticky notes or Shapes with text) you wish to generate. The plugin will automatically list them, allowing you to input custom prompts. With a single click on âGenerate Contentâ all selected text elements will be instantly generated and integrated into your design, streamlining your workflow.


AI Makes It Simple...

plugins.name: UIEditor-Exporter
plugins.description:
A utility plugin by Quicksave Interactive to make the workflow between Figma and the UI Editor a seamless experience.


This plugin allows you to export your Figma Designs to be used inside of the Quicksave UI Editor.


Be sure to read this to understand how to properly use this Exporter:


  1. Current supported UI Editor nodes are: Container, Text, Sprite.
  2. Figma's Fill and Strokes are converted to Sprite nodes (SVGs).
  3. Avoid having your UI bleeding outside their parent nodes.
  4. Keep a clear hierarchy and try to use descriptive and unique names for your nodes.
  5. You must save each image individually using the Exporter with the default name in the folder you specified. If you change these names / folders, you can update this in the UI Editor.
  6. If you encounter a missing feature, please email support for this plugin so we can look into it.
plugins.tagline: Exports Figma Designs to be used in Quicksave's UI Editor

122173.name: UIEditor-Exporter
122173.description:
A utility plugin by Quicksave Interactive to make the workflow between Figma and the UI Editor a seamless experience.


This plugin allows you to export your Figma Designs to be used inside of the Quicksave UI Editor.


Be sure to read this to understand how to properly use this Exporter:


  1. Current supported UI Editor nodes are: Container, Text, Sprite.
  2. Figma's Fill and Strokes are converted to Sprite nodes (SVGs).
  3. Avoid having your UI bleeding outside their parent nodes.
  4. Keep a clear hierarchy and try to use descriptive and unique names for your nodes.
  5. You must save each image individually using the Exporter with the default name in the folder you specified. If you change these names / folders, you can update this in the UI Editor.
  6. If you encounter a missing feature, please email support for this plugin so we can look into it.
122173.release_notes:
* UI Editor parentSize values will not exceed three decimal places after the export. 
* Text Node Horizontal Alignment and Vertical Alignment has been improved. A new container Node will be created per Text Node to ensure consistent Position and Alignment.
122173.tagline: Exports Figma Designs to be used in Quicksave's UI Editor

plugins.name: Recount
plugins.description:
Recount replaces text layers with a counter, starting from any number, based on the XY position of each selected layer.


How to use:

  1. select the layers to be counted
  2. run Recount
  3. enter a number to start from (or hit ENTER to choose 1)
  4. choose a direction to count along (or hit ENTER to use LTR)


Left-to-right and right-to-left directions are available.
plugins.tagline: Easily count layers by their position

117829.name: Recount
117829.description:
Recount replaces text layers with a counter, starting from any number, based on the XY position of each selected layer.


How to use:

  1. select the layers to be counted
  2. run Recount
  3. enter a number to start from (or hit ENTER to choose 1)
  4. choose a direction to count along (or hit ENTER to use LTR)


Left-to-right and right-to-left directions are available.
117829.tagline: Easily count layers by their position

plugins.name: Remove and select next
plugins.description:
ð FIGMA NATIVE BEHAVIOR

-> Removing a layer triggers a global deselect.

Consequently, you need to take your mouse to select the next layer you want to work on.


ð¥³ PLUGIN BEHAVIOR

-> Removing a layer select the next layer.

Meaning you don't need to take your mouse back and you can continue to design at the speed of light on your keyboard!


â¨ï¸ KEYBOARD SHORTCUT

Plugins can't have keyboard shortcuts so you'll have to set it on your own.

See this page for a tutorial on macOS native keyboard shortcuts and BetterTouchTools
plugins.tagline: Remove layers without leaving your keyboard

plugins.name: comodo exporter
plugins.description:
This plugin helps you rename and export layers named $IMG in your Figma project based on special tags. You can choose between two workflows:

  1. Destructive export: Layers are renamed and export settings applied (JPG, PNG, SVG, @1x, @2x, @3x). Once renamed, the original $IMG layers are lost, and the plugin cannot be rerun unless you revert to an earlier version.
  2. Non-destructive export: The plugin creates a new page where it duplicates and renames all matching layers, preserving the original ones. You can delete the new page and restart anytime.

A Figma template will soon be provided with pre-set tags and an organized layout to make your workflow faster and more reliable. More detailed documentation will also follow.
plugins.tagline: Rename & export $IMG layers via tags. Template & docs coming soon for easy setup.

134292.name: comodo exporter
134292.description:
This plugin helps you rename and export layers named $IMG in your Figma project based on special tags. You can choose between two workflows:

  1. Destructive export: Layers are renamed and export settings applied (JPG, PNG, SVG, @1x, @2x, @3x). Once renamed, the original $IMG layers are lost, and the plugin cannot be rerun unless you revert to an earlier version.
  2. Non-destructive export: The plugin creates a new page where it duplicates and renames all matching layers, preserving the original ones. You can delete the new page and restart anytime.

A Figma template will soon be provided with pre-set tags and an organized layout to make your workflow faster and more reliable. More detailed documentation will also follow.
134292.tagline: Rename & export $IMG layers via tags. Template & docs coming soon for easy setup.

Color Explorer is a smart Figma plugin designed to help designers, early-stage founders, agencies, strategists, DTC operators, and marketers quickly find the perfect color palettes for their brand.


With over 3,000+ curated palettes (increasing everyday), you can preview and apply full-brand color systems to any selected frame or layerâin one click.

  2. 3000+ Color Palettes: Handpicked and categorized palettes to match different brand moods and industries

plugins.name: Brand compliance check
plugins.description:
Branding compliance check Figma Plugin


Purpose

The Branding-compliance-check plugin helps designers ensure that their design elements are consistent with the assets library added to their Figma file. It highlights and marks design elements that are not from the assets library, ensuring branding compliance.


Features

  1. Design Elements Check: Verify if colors, fonts, Non-component frames & effects are from the assets library.
  2. Highlight Issues: Select and bring non-compliant elements to the user's viewport.
  3. Mark Issues: Add a red stroke around non-compliant elements.


Usage guidelines

  1. Select Design Elements: Check the boxes for the design elements you want to verify.
  2. Highlight Issues: Click the "Highlight issues" button to select and bring non-compliant elements to the viewport.
  3. Mark Issues: Click the "Mark issues" button to select and add a red stroke around non-compliant elements.
plugins.tagline: Quick sanity checks for Figma files to verify if design elements of file are brand library aligned

plugins.name: Image Compressor FREE
plugins.description:
A small but mighty Figma plugin that helps you compress and replace images right inside your designs.

Simply select one or more image layers â or let the plugin dive deep into nested frames and groups.

You can control the compression level, and the plugin will convert images to optimized JPEGs on the fly.

Perfect for preparing files for lightweight PDF exports or sharing compact mockups with clients and developers.

Minimal, clean, and respectful of your layout â this tool does one job well and doesnât get in your way.
plugins.tagline: image compression, export, lightweight, jpeg, optimization, size, nested images, size, png, jpg

plugins.name: Icon Scaler
plugins.description:
ICON SCALER :

This plugin lets you scale one or multiple selected icons into multiple standard sizes in a single click â while preserving all their styles, groups, layers, strokes, and fills. No flattening. No distortion.


But thatâs not all ââ¨It also automatically generates a variable component for each icon, so you can easily manage different icon sizes using Figma's powerful component properties.


Whether youâre preparing icon sets for design systems, exports, or different platform needs, this plugin automates the repetitive work â and gives you perfect consistency every time.


KEY FEATURES:

â Scale multiple icons at once into multiple sizes

â Preserves structure â no flattening or vector merging

â Creates a variable component with size modes for each icon

â UI with smart âchip-styleâ size selection + custom size support

â Neatly arranged output inside a new frame, ready to use or export
plugins.tagline: Create Icon Size Range and components instantly

plugins.name: Expression Blast
plugins.description:
As humans we feel. As humans we express.

We experience emotions like hunger, hangovers, confusion, or surprise. As designers especially, we often forget to eat, choosing instead to perfect one more button variation or tweak the kerning just a bit moreâat the cost of sleep.

We feel so many things, yet have so few outlets to express themâwhether we're collaborating with teammates or simply needing a small boost of joy. Thatâs why I created Expression Blast: a plugin that gives designers a playful way to express the real, everyday emotions we all experience.
plugins.tagline: An Outlet for Everyday Emotions.

plugins.name: Fast Page Selector
plugins.description:
Efficient page selection and navigation when working with files containing many pages.


Features

  1. Page Grouping: Automatically group pages using Divider pages (pages starting with `---` or containing `divider`)
  2. Select by select box: Display each group in select boxes for intuitive page selection
  3. Compact View: Hide/Show functionality to minimize plugin window and efficiently utilize workspace
plugins.tagline: Navigate hundreds of pages in a flash.

plugins.name: Auto Layout Remover
plugins.description:
Auto Layout Remover helps you quickly clean up messy Figma files and make them easier to edit or prototype.


When to use it:

  1. You want to redesign freely. If your design is full of auto layouts and deeply nested frames, and you just want to move things around without dealing with layout constraints â this plugin flattens everything so you can edit with ease.
  2. Youâre building an interactive prototype. Auto layouts often create layers and nesting that block or overlap each other. This plugin helps you clean the structure fast â so you can bring the right blocks to the top and avoid layout issues.


What it does:

  1. Turns off all auto layouts, keeping objects in place
  2. Ungroups frames and groups without visible styles (no fill, no stroke, or hidden)
  3. Deletes hidden layers and empty frames
  4. Leaves instances and styled frames untouched
  5. Makes your file flat, clean, and easy to work with
plugins.tagline: Remove all auto layouts, empty frames, and groups in one click.

  2. Youâre building an interactive prototype. Auto layouts often create layers and nesting that block or overlap each other. This plugin helps you clean the structure fast â so you can bring the right blocks to the top and avoid layout issues.


What it does:

134108.tagline: Remove all auto layouts, empty frames, and groups in one click.

plugins.name: Font Replacer
plugins.description:
Instantly view all fonts used in your selection, selectively replace specific font families, and preserve font weights and styles when switching to new fonts. Whether you're cleaning up inconsistent typography, updating your brand, or exploring new typefaces, Font Replacer makes the process fast, intuitive, and reliable.


  1. See all fonts in your selection at a glance
  2. Replace one or multiple font families with a single click
  3. Maintains font weights/styles (e.g., Bold, Italic) when switching families
  4. Handles mixed-font text layers and nested groups
  5. Smart fallbacks ensure your text always looks great
  6. Clean, modern UI with loading indicators for large selections
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly swap and manage fonts in your Figma designs

134520.name: Font Replacer
134520.description:

Whether you're cleaning up inconsistent typography, updating your brand, or exploring new typefaces, Font Replacer makes the process fast, intuitive, and reliable.


  1. See all fonts in your selection at a glance
  2. Replace one or multiple font families with a single click
  3. Maintains font weights/styles (e.g., Bold, Italic) when switching families
  4. Handles mixed-font text layers and nested groups
  5. Smart fallbacks ensure your text always looks great
  6. Clean, modern UI with loading indicators for large selections
134520.tagline: Effortlessly swap and manage fonts in your Figma designs

plugins.name: GPT to Canvas
plugins.description: This plugin helps to plot e.g. tables from chatGPT research on to your Figma or FigJam canvas to be able to overcome chat interface limitations and spatially distribute information quickly especially on lengthy brainstorms. The plugin uses the OpenAI API and requires your personal OpenAI API Key.
plugins.tagline: Plot chatGPT research on canvas
